items.title: Usability Certification Exam Prep: User-Centered Analysis

visible_instructors.name: Lyndon
visible_instructors.job_title: Design, User Experience & Usability CUA, CXA, UXMC
visible_instructors.title: Lyndon Cerejo

items.headline: Practice questions for Usability Certification exams based on concepts in User-Centered Analysis
objectives_summary: You will be able to test your knowledge about the concepts in User-Centered Analysis
The practice questions are split into three parts and all three parts should be taken to cover the range of possible topics
Note that this is one of four sections that make up the Usability Certification exam

items.title: Design Thinking Simplified
items.headline: Build Innovative Products with Design Thinking
objectives_summary: Design thinking can sprout organic growth and sustainable innovation. Given its capability for deep user immersion via uncovering unarticulated needs and perspectives while having the leeway to explore multiple ideas in an innovative setting were failing fast for a more robust success is not a taboo but encouraged.
Module 1: Gathering Insights  Understand design thinking framework through case studies Identifying users pain points Learn how to gather data and contextualize them into a meaningful architecture
Module 2: Ideation  Reframing and Ideation - Go wide and wild problem-solving technique Know how to foresee the needs based on user personas
